main event: On November 19, 1955, 5-7 disc-shaped objects were observed on the ground radar in Lake County, Ohio for approximately 1 hour. The objects moved at varying speeds and erratic courses, visually observed by the radar crew.
interesting points: The sighting involved 5-7 disc-shaped objects observed on the ground radar for approximately 1 hour, moving at varying speeds and erratic courses.
The objects were also visually observed by the radar crew, adding credibility to the sighting.

The report includes a separate sighting of a UFO by Mrs. [redacted] in University Circle Physics Office on November 8, 1957, which described a bright, basketball-sized object moving from west to east and then vertically upwards, without any sound or vapor trails.

Another interview on November 8, 1957, involved Mr. [redacted] driving from Painesville, who described a bright glowing object about 50 feet in diameter that changed color from blue to yellow to white, hovered briefly, then accelerated and disappeared with a faint hum.

The witness also mentioned the object's color, shape, and noise, reporting a blueish green color, flat round shape with a flare at the bottom, and a humming sound like a running light motor, adding detailed characteristics to the sighting.
sighted object: 5-7 disc-shaped objects on ground radar, bright glowing object of about 50 feet in diameter, and a basketball-sized bright object
